snippet.title: Labyrinth of Crete walkthrough (Apple II - Adventure International)
snippet.description:
"LABYRINTH OF CRETE paves the way for an entirely new form of Adventuring - you control the action of TWO separate characters! That's right, the player is in complete control of two powerful warriors, the stalwart Jason, and the mighty-thawed Hercules. Straight from the mythology of Ancient Greece they come, and their quest is a most dangerous one, indeed -- the recovery of the mythical Golden Fleece from the heart of the horrific Labyrinth! But have a care, O rash one; the designer of the maze, Daedalus of Crete, crafted well the nefarious network. Evil most foul abounds within its walls, including all manner of traps, tricks and a gruesome parade of maze inhabitants. Many have tried, and many have failed to penetrate and exit the Labyrinth -- will you be able to direct Jason and Hercules to success?"

The Labyrinth of Crete (https://www.mobygames.com/game/labyrinth-of-crete) was a graphics adventure game published by Adventure International in 1981 for the Apple ][. This was one of the few non-Scott Adams game published by the company that featured some graphics, albeit the game is mostly text-based. The game was super hard to find, so thank you 4AM for making it available!

Hope you enjoy the walkthrough!

The long play is done by Smartadventurer, a program that I wrote to automate the playing for vintage Apple ][ games. You can follow the project here: https://vinniethelung.wordpress.com/tag/smartadventurer/

Credits:
Cover art - mocagh.org
Walkthrough - www.solutionarchive.com (Alex Dijkstra)
Disk image - 4AM
